comment: This is generated by ESQL's AbstractFunctionTestCase. Do no edit it. See ../README.md for how to regenerate it.
name: date_format
description: Returns a string representation of a date, in the provided format.

params.name: dateFormat
params.description: Date format (optional).  If no format is specified, the `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ` format is used. If `null`, the function returns `null`.

params.name: date
params.description: Date expression. If `null`, the function returns `null`.

params.name: dateFormat
params.description: Date format (optional).  If no format is specified, the `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ` format is used. If `null`, the function returns `null`.

params.name: date
params.description: Date expression. If `null`, the function returns `null`.

examples:
FROM employees
| KEEP first_name, last_name, hire_date
| EVAL hired = DATE_FORMAT("YYYY-MM-dd", hire_date)
